pageContext.claim: “[Question: Jerome Powell, he says that he can stay in office for four years, but do you think you have the power to remove him?] Well, he's incorrect. If I wanted to, but I have no plans to anything.”
pageContext.analysis: Powell, the chairman of the Federal Reserve board of governors, was confirmed by the Senate to a four-year term. He says Trump cannot legally fire him, despite their differences on monetary policy. The Federal Reserve Act says the president may fire the Fed chair only "for cause," a high bar that usually requires some form of misconduct and not merely policy disagreements. But it's a largely untested legal question.
